items.title: Reimagining Diana
items.blurb: An alternative history imagining what might have happened if Diana had survived that night in Paris.

items.title: Britain's Royal Families
items.blurb: A fascinating and authoritative history of Britain’s royal families from the Tudors to the Windsors.

items.title: The Royal Line of Succession
items.blurb: The best-selling illustrated guide to the British Monarchy and the succession process, updated for 2018.

items.title: Queen Elizabeth II & the Royal Family
items.blurb: A tribute to Queen Elizabeth II, celebrating her life and reign, with profiles of key royals and landmark events.

items.title: The Crown – Season 1
items.blurb: Focuses on Queen Elizabeth II as a 25-year-old newlywed facing the prospect of leading the monarchy.

items.title: The Crown – Season 2
items.blurb: Continues the story of Queen Elizabeth in the late 1950s and early 1960s.

items.title: The Crown – Season 3
items.blurb: Covers 1964–1977, from Harold Wilson’s election to the Silver Jubilee, starring Olivia Colman.

items.title: The Crown – Season 4
items.blurb: Depicts 1979–1990 under Margaret Thatcher and introduces Lady Diana Spencer.

items.title: The Crown – Season 5
items.blurb: Diana and Charles wage a media war as the monarchy faces questions of relevance.

items.title: The Crown – Seasons 1–4 box set
items.blurb: A collection of the first four seasons of The Crown.

items.title: Victoria – Season 1
items.blurb: The early years of Queen Victoria’s reign starring Jenna Coleman.

items.title: Victoria – Season 2
items.blurb: Victoria resumes her role as queen while balancing motherhood and marriage.

items.title: Victoria – Season 3
items.blurb: Depicts the turbulent period starting in 1848 amid revolutions in Europe and Chartism in London.

items.title: Victoria – Christmas Special
items.blurb: Victoria and Albert face different expectations at Christmas in a festive special.

items.title: The Young Victoria
items.blurb: Emily Blunt stars in a dramatisation of the young queen’s early years and marriage to Prince Albert.

items.title: The Favourite
items.blurb: Yorgos Lanthimos’s acclaimed drama about Queen Anne, Lady Sarah and Abigail.
